commit_message:
Release as a plugin spec

Change-Id: I191c6cbb6237aef1948773cbf3976b2c2010a5fc
Implements Blueprint:release-as-a-plugin
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/69/351569/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================== Release as a plugin =================== Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin As a Mirantis Engineer I want to express a Fuel Release as a Fuel Plugin so that I could define, maintain and deploy various flavors of customized OpenStack deployments in a clean isolated way, externalized from common Fuel provisioning layer. ------------------- Problem description ------------------- The nailgun repo sill holds onto one of the remaining parts of the data model the release fixture. This fixture is used to describe everything about the deployment from the ground up and is where every change can possibly be expressed. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- By moving the release fixtures ``openstack.yaml`` completely into the plugin framework we opening road to following changes: * To make ``fuel-library`` repo a plugin. * It is possible to ship multiple openstack version release packages as each is its own plugin. * Next steps allowing Fuel to have different releases bundled or no pre-bundled releases at all (lightweight version) are possible as well. Web UI ====== Support of the case when there are ``no release`` is required. Nailgun ======= Data model ---------- Data model of Nailgun will be left intact except the changes in incoming release configuration. REST API -------- It should be possible to run command, installing releases from a given path. Orchestration ============= RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== None Plugins installation is not changing. Plugins ======= Plugin adapters --------------- Fuel plugin adapter should now be able to understand new format of ``release:`` records declared in plugin ``metadata.yaml``. Release loader should be integrated with plugin adapters. Release package --------------- If there is no relations to the existing releases are defined it is supposed that plugin contains release data defined in ``releases:`` section. ``name`` attribute is a hallmark of release definition. ``is_hotpluggable`` flag is not available for the release plugins and will be ignored. Installation of releases should be performed before releases extension (existing plugins functionality) operations. Example of ``metadata.yaml``: .. code-block:: yaml releases: -name: 'MyRelease' #required description: 'Description' #required operating_system: 'ubuntu' #required, or its alias os: version: '10.0' #required networks_path: ubuntu-10.0/networks_metadata.yaml volumes_path: ubuntu-10.0/volumes_metadata.yaml roles_path: ubuntu-10.0/roles_metadata.yaml network_roles_path: ubuntu-10.0/network_roles_metadata.yaml components_path: ubuntu-10.0/components_metadata.yaml attributes_path: ubuntu-10.0/attributes_metadata.yaml vmware_attributes_path: ubuntu-10.0/vmware_attributes_metadata.yaml node_attributes_path: ubuntu-10.0/node_attributes.yaml nic_attributes_path: ubuntu-10.0/nic_attributes.yaml bond_attributes_path: ubuntu-10.0/bond_attributes.yaml deployment_tasks_path: ubuntu-10.0/deployment_tasks.yaml - os: ubuntu version: liberty-8.0 deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu - os: ubuntu version: mitaka-9.0 deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu - os: ubuntu version: newton-10.0 deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu Deprecation ----------- ``modes`` release parameter is deprecated and will be removed in further versions. ``tasks.yaml`` no further supported. Fuel Library ============ In perspective current Fuel Library should become a plugin. ------------ Alternatives ------------ None -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- It will be possible to ship release upgrades as a plugin. --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- Fuel Plugin Builder =================== Fuel Plugin Builder validator should be able to validate new releases parameter structure. --------------- End user impact --------------- None ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ None ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- None ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- This feature is highly affects Fuel plugins and library developers. --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- Add documentation about fuel plugins format. -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: ikutukov@mirantis.com Other contributors: Mandatory design review: bgaifulin@mirantis.com ikalnitsky@mirantis.com Work Items ========== * Bump plugins version (TBD version number). * Add to ongiong Fuel release support of new manifest version. * Add to old Fuel releases ability to ignore releases records of the new version. Dependencies ============ None ----------- Testing, QA ----------- * Manual testing Acceptance criteria =================== * It is possible to deploy configuration with specific set of plugins and packages. * It is possible to perform only discover/provision and manage HostOS + underlay storage and networking. * Vanilla Fuel 9.1 installation is possible without and release definition - only provisioning layer is in, expecting user to add releases. ---------- References ---------- None

commit_message:

Use the proper name for pyOpenSSL in RDO

According to https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyOpenSSL/16.0.0, the
right name is pyOpenSSL, not pyopenssl.

commit_message:
Add GrubPassword module to the fuelmenu

This change adds new GrubPassword module to the fuelmenu which can
configure password for the editing grub menu. The module creates the
default /boot/grub2/user.cfg file with hashed password only when it
entered interactively. For security reasons the plain password never
stored and the file always overwritten with new one provided.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1552164
Change-Id: I3bc330133dd3d71ea62a7169a84d9ad802a4a3ef
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

Removed directory changes in npm-dsvm-macro

These cause errors, and I'm not actually certain they're
necessary. See below for an example:

2016-08-23 20:54:06.076004 | + DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076015 | + export DISPLAY=:99
2016-08-23 20:54:06.076025 | + DISPLAY=:99

commit_message:
Double rax-ord boot-timeout value

We are seeing a large amount of subnodes failing to boot in rax-ord,
lets double our boot-timeout to see if this solves some of the
problem.

Change-Id: I9f036228a927ba21b7f03b6137b6d7a7346b5aff
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/96/359496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: boot-timeout: 240

commit_message:
tests: fix data_files testing

The current data-files entry is not used by any tests, and is actually not
working. The glob features only support * at the end of the path, and the
config key is 'data_files', not "data_files".

Fix this and add a test proving it works.

Change-Id: I9a9a9e138e7feb314187409e3087567f35264344
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/60/278360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data_files = data_files = data_files/*

commit_message:
Add a dynamic ansible inventory script

This commit adds an ansible dynamic inventory script that retrieve node
information from heat and other OpenStack services and allows to
connect to known nodes in the TripleO deployment.

The script is strongly inspired by the dynamic inventory of the now
retired tripleo-ansible project:

https://github.com/stackforge/tripleo-ansible/blob/bd0346b55b586d591e6ca46aa42fc3002fa3dd45/plugins/inventory/heat.py

Change-Id: I807fed12e9a42a71c130f393370ff4152831c27b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/05/348305/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: scripts = scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ife2543bc31592d612f884dc354876e0ee30497e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/29/358929/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception: raise except Exception: raise
deleted_lines: except Exception as e: raise e except Exception as e: raise e

commit_message:
Temporary compatibility layer for numhosts property support.

Temporary fix: AttributeError: 'IPNetwork' object has no attribute 'numhosts'

Change-Id: Ic3b18de3fc3b3e37cd6250a8e26ff010a3a6d80c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/88/339388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _numhosts(self): msg = ( 'numhosts property is temporary compatibility spike ' 'and will be dropped soon! ' 'Replace by len(list(IPNetwork().iter_hosts())) if required.' ) logger.warning(msg) warn(msg, DeprecationWarning) return len(list(self.iter_hosts())) IPNetwork.numhosts = property( fget=_numhosts, doc="""Temporary compatibility layer for numhosts property support.""")

commit_message:
Specify 'become' to neccesary tasks (last)

Add become to only neccesary tasks in roles:
- ceilometer
- elasticsearch
- ironic
- kibana
- magnum
- manila
- mongodb
- multipathd
- murano
- tempest
- watcher

Change-Id: Ia7b860e3432e9d90bb004f2c2c854613adaf4495
Partial-Implements: blueprint ansible-specific-task-become

subject: Relocate alarm service into a submodule
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 10:37:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/7af48ebeb87bd01bebf4deede8c95adbd67a2541', 'message': "Move alarm/alarm_change to new alarm service

As announced recently in mailinglist, ceilometer itself is no longer
accepting changes to alarms related changes. All those changes are to be
submitted to project aodh, the 'alarming' service. Although there will
be a period during which you can still use ceilometerclient to mask the
differences, eventually, all alarms related services will be provided by
aodh. Since SDK is not using xyzclient, we will need to talk to this
service directly.

This patch moves the alarm/alarm_change resource out of telemetry
service, and it moves the unit tests and functional tests as well.

Change-Id: I0c2521443225e41b4090ee7ecb5f095072b1fc95
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-23 11:48:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/4913e681be71c7bb4e76793f1e22384137972ccd', 'message': "Move alarm/alarm_change to new alarm service

As announced recently in mailinglist, ceilometer itself is no longer
accepting changes to alarms related changes. All those changes are to be
submitted to project aodh, the 'alarming' service. Although there will
be a period during which you can still use ceilometerclient to mask the
differences, eventually, all alarms related services will be provided by
aodh. Since SDK is not using xyzclient, we will need to talk to this
service directly.

This patch moves the alarm/alarm_change resource out of telemetry
service, and it moves the unit tests and functional tests as well.

Change-Id: I0c2521443225e41b4090ee7ecb5f095072b1fc95

commit_message:
Relocate alarm service into a submodule

This patch moves the resources of the alarm service (aodh) into a
submodule of the telemetry, as a service that can be addressed using
'alarm' as service type.

Change-Id: I0c2521443225e41b4090ee7ecb5f095072b1fc95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/89/226689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import testtools from openstack.alarm.v2 import capability EXAMPLE = { "id": "123", "enabled": False, } BODY = { "api": { "statistics:query:complex": False, "alarms:history:query:simple": True, "alarms:query:simple": True, "resources:query:simple": False, } } class TestCapability(testtools.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = capability.Capability() self.assertEqual('capability', sot.resource_key) self.assertEqual('capabilities', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/capabilities', sot.base_path) self.assertEqual('alarming', sot.service.service_type) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_create) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_retrieve) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_update) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_delete) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_list) def test_make_it(self): sot = capability.Capability(EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['id'], sot.id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['enabled'], sot.enabled) def test_list(self): sess = mock.Mock() resp = mock.Mock() resp.body = BODY sess.get = mock.Mock(return_value=resp) caps = capability.Capability.list(sess) caps = sorted(caps, key=lambda cap: cap.id) self.assertEqual(4, len(caps)) self.assertEqual('alarms:history:query:simple', caps[0].id) self.assertEqual(True, caps[0].enabled) self.assertEqual('alarms:query:simple', caps[1].id) self.assertEqual(True, caps[1].enabled) self.assertEqual('resources:query:simple', caps[2].id) self.assertEqual(False, caps[2].enabled) self.assertEqual('statistics:query:complex', caps[3].id) self.assertEqual(False, caps[3].enabled)

commit_message:
Unify the type of value for what are True/False values

I'm going to unify the type of value for
what are True/False values.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1589865

A above patch is related a bootable field
in cinder volume.
To merge a above patch, tempest(cinder gate test)
should consider a boolean type.

This patch is temporary patch to accommodate
boolean type and string type until fixed a above patch.

Closes-Bug: #1589865
Change-Id: Ic582949b67e2d35a86ad6559c791aa0e424d1a12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/331400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six if isinstance(fetched_volume['bootable'], six.string_types): self.assertEqual(True, fetched_volume['bootable']) else self.assertTrue(fetched_volume['bootable']) if 'imageRef' not in kwargs: if isinstance(fetched_volume['bootable'], six.string_types): self.assertEqual(False, fetched_volume['bootable']) else self.assertFalse(fetched_volume['bootable']) if isinstance(updated_volume['bootable'], six.string_types): self.assertEqual(True, updated_volume['bootable']) else self.assertTrue(updated_volume['bootable']) if 'imageRef' not in kwargs: if isinstance(updated_volume['bootable'], six.string_types): self.assertEqual(False, updated_volume['bootable']) else self.assertFalse(updated_volume['bootable'])
deleted_lines: self.assertEqual('true', fetched_volume['bootable']) if 'imageRef' not in kwargs: self.assertEqual('false', fetched_volume['bootable']) self.assertEqual('true', updated_volume['bootable']) if 'imageRef' not in kwargs: self.assertEqual('false', updated_volume['bootable'])

subject: Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 19:10:51.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/commit/fdb40f51e698290edf19ff0b5e3349496c69a195', 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Id9f2bc855dcd4b8a777eeaf634ac79786a3d01f3

commit_message:
Include option to set SSLCertificateChainFile

Some cert providers require an chain cert file so this allows for this option.
In addition, I added tests for SSL that were missing for the apache vhost file.

commit_message:
Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4

ironic-api doesn't work with specified pecan versions.
Distros rely on values from global-requirements when setting
dependency caps for packages. We need to block non-working versions
to keep openstack packages dependencies in sync.

Change-Id: I7f34d6bc2f098086c086c3ea0410672d6139d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1615645
(cherry picked from commit 95316c278d8c69e4275dd7e4284a1cefff2fecd1)

commit_message:
Set default/fix version numbers in upgrade script

This commit does the following:

1. Sets a default for I_REALLY_KNOW_WHAT_I_AM_DOING

Without this default, the script will error due to an unbound variable.
This happens as we have a 'set -u' specified in the script.

2. Updates version numbers from 12->13 to 13->14

Change-Id: I97c02d44722342b1867b4400921a66e6b2ea8a48
(cherry picked from commit d3aaab4745207507fb28e212394734da668b0747)

deleted_lines: This script will perform a v11.x to v12.x upgrade. echo "Running Upgrade from v11.x to v12.x"

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects.
In the Openstack style guidelines they recommend to import only modules.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I80c70abd2f6973e1285eb7af2871d40d0a276712

commit_message:
Filter the maxImageMeta out of limits API after 2.35

The image API was already deprecated after 2.35. But the ImageMetadata
API was forgotten to deprecate. This patch filter the maxImageMeta
field out of limits API after 2.35.

Change-Id: I34bd76971965a8b2f9f9e75fc16ef2c63b476008
Closes-Bug: #1614578

commit_message:
Refactor validate_resource_definitions()

We moved validate_resource_definitions() to template_common.py
for hot/cfn in Commit ed08e4f676d4512209937289e2068b62fb8591a0,
but then the Change I8fda1380504d1d8b1e96649bf20b86d6309fdeca
overwrote the method to validate the 'external_id', in fact
we could overwrite validate_resource_definition().

Change-Id: I1c6ce382d4d968602504f2e79f903c6d521cf288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/31/358931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_resource_definition(self, name, data): super(HOTemplate20161014, self).validate_resource_definition( name, data) self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_EXTERNAL_ID, (six.string_types, function.Function), 'string', self._RESOURCE_KEYS, name, data)
deleted_lines: def validate_resource_definitions(self, stack): resources = self.t.get(self.RESOURCES) or {} allowed_keys = set(self._RESOURCE_KEYS) try: for name, snippet in resources.items(): path = '.'.join([self.RESOURCES, name]) data = self.parse(stack, snippet, path) if not self.validate_resource_key_type(self.RES_TYPE, six.string_types, 'string', allowed_keys, name, data): args = {'name': name, 'type_key': self.RES_TYPE} msg = _('Resource %(name)s is missing ' '"%(type_key)s"') % args raise KeyError(msg) self._validate_resource_key_types(allowed_keys, name, data) except (TypeError, ValueError) as ex: raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=six.text_type(ex)) def _validate_resource_key_types(self, allowed_keys, name, data): self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_PROPERTIES, (collections.Mapping, function.Function), 'object', allowed_keys, name, data) self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_METADATA, (collections.Mapping, function.Function), 'object', allowed_keys, name, data) self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_DEPENDS_ON, collections.Sequence, 'list or string', allowed_keys, name, data) self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_DELETION_POLICY, (six.string_types, function.Function), 'string', allowed_keys, name, data) self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_UPDATE_POLICY, (collections.Mapping, function.Function), 'object', allowed_keys, name, data) def _validate_resource_key_types(self, allowed_keys, name, data): super(HOTemplate20161014, self)._validate_resource_key_types( allowed_keys, name, data) self.validate_resource_key_type( self.RES_EXTERNAL_ID, (six.string_types, function.Function), 'string', allowed_keys, name, data)

subject: Load resources from DB for resource list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 07:05:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/6843399da252599316b253757c95cd8adc0b8708', 'message': "Convergence: Load resources from DB for API calls

Currently, when a user makes an API call to list resources, they were retrieved
from the currently active template associated with the stack. This worked in
the legacy engine where no concurrent updates where possible. With convergence
and thus concurrent updates, a stack is allowed to have resources of previous
traversals and still continue creating new resources. Therefore, relying on the
template to list resources won't exactly match the state in the database.

For example, on deletes where we update with an empty template, currently, the
stack parses the empty template searching for resources. Doing a
`resource-list` when the stack is in a state of DELETE_IN_PROGRESS shows an
empty list of resources and therefore not matching the state in the database.

The current patch creates a new property in stack to retreive all the resources
from the database which will be used to return to the user than just the
resources that belong to the template. Each resource object will be loaded
separately by using the resource definition of the template it was attached to
the last time it was worked on.

Change-Id: Ibe87a773c38efb6d4865fd3a1dbd079972dd8be4
Closes-Bug: #1523748

commit_message:
Load resources from DB for resource list

Currently, when a user makes an API call to list resources, they were
retrieved from the currently active template associated with the
stack. This worked in the legacy engine where no concurrent updates
where possible. With convergence and thus concurrent updates, a stack
is allowed to have resources of previous traversals and still continue
creating new resources. Therefore, relying on the template to list
resources won't exactly match the state in the database.

For example, on deletes where we update with an empty template,
currently, the stack parses the empty template searching for
resources. Doing a `resource-list` when the stack is in a state of
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS shows an empty list of resources and therefore not
matching the state in the database.

This change makes iter_resources always call _find_filtered_resources
which builds all its resources from a database query.

Change-Id: Ibe87a773c38efb6d4865fd3a1dbd079972dd8be4
Closes-Bug: #1523748
Closes-Bug: #1301320
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/31/278231/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if resource_name not in stack.all_resources: resource = stack.all_resources[resource_name] return api.format_stack_resource(stack.all_resources[resource_name], rsrc = stack.all_resources[resource_name] resource = stack.all_resources[rs.name] for name, resource in six.iteritems(stack.all_resources) return [api.format_stack_resource(resource, detail=with_detail) for resource in stack.iter_resources(depth, all_resources=True)]
deleted_lines: if resource_name not in stack: resource = stack[resource_name] return api.format_stack_resource(stack[resource_name], rsrc = stack[resource_name] resource = stack[rs.name] for name, resource in six.iteritems(stack) return [api.format_stack_resource(resource, detail=with_detail) for resource in stack.iter_resources(depth)]

commit_message:
Fix rst format for keep_db_consistency.rst

Change-Id: I2f251de8c46cbf6252b5dc7523a07c72246aced9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/16/359116/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: inserts a lock record into Neutron DB according to the current object. check the lock has been obtained or not. If not, it updates the lock state and commits the transaction. If exception happens, it will re-try it for several times. If the lock has been obtained, it will wait and re-try. and others will be deadlocked. Here we introduce DB retry mechanism. If deadlock exception happens, it will retry it to make sure it will be committed later. due to the inconsistency window of DF DB. If the update on DF DB is always delayed because the previous operations have already been delayed. The root cause is that Neutron DB is strongly consistent but DF DB is eventually consistent. We cannot guarantee the updates on DF DB is committed. successfully, if there happened some exceptions in DF DB operations or PUB/SUB process, Neutron plugin should rollback the previous commit, and raise a creation exception. no need to rollback when catch exception in DF DB operations, for instance, it is impossible and unnecessary to rollback all the Neutron DB data for a deleted VM, and we can deal with the dirty data in DF DB by other methods. if an object in Neutron DB could not be found in DF DB, the object should be considered create, if an object in DF DB could not be found in Neutron DB, the object should be considered delete, while if an object exists in both DF DB and Neutron DB, but the object version is different, the object should be considered update, if the version is same, the object should be considered same and pass it. if the object is still not exist, we should create this object to DF DB, while if the object is exist in DF DB because the object maybe updated during the db comparison, so we consider it is not a creating object any more and delete the status of this object from cache. if the object is not exist because the object maybe deleted during the db comparison or the object is exist but the object is changed because it maybe updated during the db comparison, so we should delete the status of this object from cache, otherwise, we should update this object to DF DB. directly.:: the current master data record which describe the info of master plugin periodically. If normal plugin found master plugin break down, it will update its own data record to become new master plugin and change the old master to normal and set status to down. Also master Neutron plugin should detect other plugins to confirm they are alive periodically. not be released, so each Neutron plugin should check the created-time in the db-lock and if it found the db-lock is timeout, it could own the db-lock instead of the crashed Neutron plugin. notify all the existing local VM ports, and local controller will fetch the corresponding data according to the tenants that these VMs belong to from DF DB. local controller and DF DB, and also the pub/sub connection between local controller and pub/sub system are recovered, the driver should notify local controller a recover message, local controller process the recover message: This is definitely not optimal. We can use distributed lock to only protect NB-API operations and introduce versioned object and synchronization mechanism [4]. If the versions in Neutron DB and DF DB are not equal, we sync the object from Neutron DB to DF DB to guarantee the data is consistent. atomic operations on a set of read/write operations, we can refactor the current SQL-based implementation. of two distinct databases. We only need to make sure a set of read/write operations of DF DB is atomic to prevent from race due to concurrency. This solution is appealing but not feasible if we cannot solve the inconsistent read issue caused by eventual consistency of db backend.

commit_message:
[arch-design-draft] Migrate content

1. Migrate customer requirements content from
arch-guide-draft-mitaka to the Overview chapter
and Design chapter
2. Migrate Provisioning and Deployment section
from the Ops Guide to the Overview chapter

Implements: blueprint arch-guide-restructure

commit_message:
Docs update for zone import and export

This patch updates the REST API docs for
GET zones/tasks/imports and GET zones/tasks/exports
to include metadata field.

commit_message:
Deprecated the image-metadata API after 2.35

The image API was deprecated after 2.35 already. But the sub-resource
image-metadata of image was forgotten to deprecate. This patch deprecate
the image-metdata API after 2.35.

Change-Id: I8d933c2124ec2021f9fa0b706a7a2de223e36e80
Partial-Bug: #1614578

commit_message:
Handle invalid input sent to monasca-forwarder

When an invalid json input is sent to monasca-forwarder API,
the exception is not caught and handled properly. This patch fixes
the existing try;except logic to encapsulate the json decoding operation
so that the exception is caught.

Closes-Bug: #1613827
Change-Id: Icc717c3b8cf2c5880f2ba7823746b31780b1a2de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/71/356071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 22:50:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2df5ef79aaa0da8e70d02a006d50deaffe0a149e', 'message': "Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes

When we perform a local delete in the compute API during the volumes
cleanup, Nova calls the volume_api.terminate_connection passing a fake
volume connector. That call is useless and it has no real effect on the
volume server side.

With a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6 in mitaka we started
stashing the connector in the bdm.connection_info so this change
tries to use that if it's available, which it won't be for attachments
made before that change -or- for volumes attached to an instance in
shelved_offloaded state that were never unshelved (because the actual
volume attach for those instances happens on the compute manager after
you unshelve the instance).

If we can't find a stashed connector, or we find one whose host does
not match the instance.host, we punt and just don't call
terminate_connection at all since calling it with a fake connector
can actually make some cinder volume backends fail and then the
volume is orphaned.

Closes-Bug: #1609984

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9f9ead51238e27fa45084c8e3d3edee76a8b0218
(cherry picked from commit 33510d4be990417d2a3a428106f6f745db5af6ed)
"}]
commit_message:
Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes

When we perform a local delete in the compute API during the volumes
cleanup, Nova calls the volume_api.terminate_connection passing a fake
volume connector. That call is useless and it has no real effect on the
volume server side.

With a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6 in mitaka we started
stashing the connector in the bdm.connection_info so this change
tries to use that if it's available, which it won't be for attachments
made before that change -or- for volumes attached to an instance in
shelved_offloaded state that were never unshelved (because the actual
volume attach for those instances happens on the compute manager after
you unshelve the instance).

If we can't find a stashed connector, or we find one whose host does
not match the instance.host, we punt and just don't call
terminate_connection at all since calling it with a fake connector
can actually make some cinder volume backends fail and then the
volume is orphaned.

Closes-Bug: #1609984

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9f9ead51238e27fa45084c8e3d3edee76a8b0218
(cherry picked from commit 33510d4be990417d2a3a428106f6f745db5af6ed)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/352050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_stashed_volume_connector(self, bdm, instance): """Lookup a connector dict from the bdm.connection_info if set Gets the stashed connector dict out of the bdm.connection_info if set and the connector host matches the instance host. :param bdm: nova.objects.block_device.BlockDeviceMapping :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance :returns: volume connector dict or None """ if 'connection_info' in bdm and bdm.connection_info is not None: # NOTE(mriedem): We didn't start stashing the connector in the # bdm.connection_info until Mitaka so it might not be there on old # attachments. Also, if the volume was attached when the instance # was in shelved_offloaded state and it hasn't been unshelved yet # we don't have the attachment/connection information either. connector = jsonutils.loads(bdm.connection_info).get('connector') if connector: if connector.get('host') == instance.host: return connector LOG.debug('Found stashed volume connector for instance but ' 'connector host %(connector_host)s does not match ' 'the instance host %(instance_host)s.', {'connector_host': connector.get('host'), 'instance_host': instance.host}, instance=instance) try: connector = self._get_stashed_volume_connector( bdm, instance) if connector: self.volume_api.terminate_connection(context, bdm.volume_id, connector) else: LOG.debug('Unable to find connector for volume %s, ' 'not attempting terminate_connection.', bdm.volume_id, instance=instance) # Attempt to detach the volume. If there was no connection # made in the first place this is just cleaning up the # volume state in the Cinder database.
deleted_lines: Note that at this point we do not have the information about the correct connector so we pass a fake one. # NOTE(vish): We don't have access to correct volume # connector info, so just pass a fake # connector. This can be improved when we # expose get_volume_connector to rpc. connector = {'ip': '127.0.0.1', 'initiator': 'iqn.fake'} try: self.volume_api.terminate_connection(context, bdm.volume_id, connector)

subject: Return HTTP 200 on list for invalid status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-01 14:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/list-server-bad-status-fix-7db504b38c8d732f.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/extended_server_attributes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_extended_server_attributes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9a97047850e6febce090cee9a5f2224cdf02a2c3', 'message': 'Return HTTP 200 on list for invalid status

The server listing API raises a 500 error if you pass an invalid status
filter for admin user. In the case of a non-admin user, it simply
returns an empty list. In the case of an admin user, it fetches extended
server attributes, so a condition was added to get extended server
attributes only when servers list is not empty.

This change simply removes the cause of the 500 exception. A subsequent
patch with a microversion bump will modify the behavior so that a 400
Bad Request will be raised for an invalid status, for both admin and
non-admin alike.

Co-Authored-By: Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>

Closes-Bug: #1579706

Change-Id: I10bde78f0a9ac59b8646d58f62fa5056f989f54f
(cherry picked from commit ee4d69e28dfb3d4764186d0c0212d53c99bda3ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Return HTTP 200 on list for invalid status

The server listing API raises a 500 error if you pass an invalid status
filter for admin user. In the case of a non-admin user, it simply
returns an empty list. In the case of an admin user, it fetches extended
server attributes, so a condition was added to get extended server
attributes only when servers list is not empty.

This change simply removes the cause of the 500 exception. A subsequent
patch with a microversion bump will modify the behavior so that a 400
Bad Request will be raised for an invalid status, for both admin and
non-admin alike.

Co-Authored-By: Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>

Closes-Bug: #1579706

Change-Id: I10bde78f0a9ac59b8646d58f62fa5056f989f54f
(cherry picked from commit ee4d69e28dfb3d4764186d0c0212d53c99bda3ca)

commit_message:
don't report network limits after 2.35

We correctly stopped reporting the limits for things like security
groups and floating ips after mv 2.35. We completely missed that
limits are modified by the used_limits extension, and hilarity
ensued. We were reporting no maxSecurityGroups over the wire, but we
were reporting totalSecurityGroups through the magic of extensions.

Change-Id: I85b2b41d919ed6987d4c9288905ccce49c10c81f
Closes-Bug: #1614133

commit_message:
Nova_APIGW REST API Microversion Support

1. What is the problem
The current Nova_APIGW does not support microversion function, the service
controller uses a fixed API version number to initialize novaclient

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the service controller receives an API request, it will get the
microversion number from request headers , and use this to initialize
novaclient.

For how to get the microversion number, please refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html

The microversion supported range is 2.36 to latest version

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Nova_APIGW microversion support added

Change-Id: I64c757508fb0a244fa88fa56a6d9d4aa27a9739a

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I64485da329b9ac8915675885783ffd5b2bf81ea6

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are
being renamed to ``project_id``.

This neutron_taas change accompanies the neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Change-Id: I71087973031ebe479bbd13e3af6cd079174e28cb
Related Blueprint: keystone-v3
Closes-Bug: #1522645

commit_message:
Consistent fixed network name

Fixed network name for kubernetes driver has been given
"private". For mesos and swarm driver, fixed network name's are
generated.

if consistency has to be maintained then fixed network name's for
mesos and swarm driver has to be "private" because kubernetes driver
does not support any other names.

Change-Id: Ia7c462c42ecf7cbe411254aa6a046a2c9ddc64b5
Closes-bug: #1523402

commit_message:
Fix reported driver's versions

This is part of the effort to gather accurate information
about Cinder drivers. Some drivers are not reporting the
driver version in the driver class, and therefore, the
'./generate_driver_list.py' script is getting the information
('N/A') from the base class.

Change-Id: I3beae8fdd7e65d3688b930943ef74abe4b29d799

commit_message:
Fix Tempest tests

Fix monasca_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_statistics.TestStatistics.
test_list_statistics_with_offset_limit by assuming offset is an
opaque value and making sure it is urldecoded and urlencoded as
it should be. Also, previously, the test was trying to use an offset
returned by measurement-list and apply it to metric-statistics.
That is not required to work by the API definition and should not
be attempted

Fix the Alarm State tests by using the offset returned from the
API and not trying to build one. Also, ensure offset is urldecoded
and urlencoded as should be

Change-Id: Ib4ad5b7f0450dd9415496276b38bd12f2921e5d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/87/340587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: num_metrics = len(metric) self._check_timeout(i, constants.MAX_RETRIES, elements, num_metrics) str(end_time) + '&period=1' + '&limit=' + str(num_metrics) self.assertEqual(num_metrics, len(elements)) for limit in xrange(1, num_metrics): '&merge_metrics=true&start_time=' + elements[0][0] + \ self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) offset = self._get_offset(response_body) start_index = 0 while True: num_expected_elements = limit if (num_expected_elements + start_index) > num_metrics: num_expected_elements = num_metrics - start_index self.assertEqual(num_expected_elements, len(new_elements)) expected_elements = elements[start_index:start_index+limit] start_index += num_expected_elements if start_index >= num_metrics: break # Get the next set offset = self._get_offset(response_body) def _get_offset(self, response_body): for link in response_body['links']: if link['rel'] == 'next': next_link = link['href'] if not next_link: self.fail("No next link returned with query parameters: {}".format(query_parms)) offset = helpers.get_query_param(next_link, "offset") return offset

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix ssh driver to to prevent prompting

This patch fix the bug which was resolved in
this patch Ib1e38f397afaac96a2e1a8717c87a4b6756419db
but got lost after the merge of this
I586a9faa2a7afa3f195239df305898b6da4fb583 patch

Change-Id: I75d09832980a88752b061309e80c3fcfce1f2fcc
(cherry picked from commit b274a85e968242cfb9bf44925a7266ecd4ce2243)

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for upper constraints

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: Ieecf9a43fb115a538ffca9511468b33fb9d3df40
Closes-Bug: #1614361

Version 1.2.0 of puppetlabs_spec_helper pulled in a version gem with

TripleO CI has ruby 2.0 so we need to pin the gem.

Change-Id: I614ce29e83265ee48bb5f35fdd4a956346b0c69d

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs_spec_helper to 1.1.1

Version 1.2.0 of puppetlabs_spec_helper pulled in a version gem with
ruby 2.2 requirements.
TripleO CI has ruby 2.0 so we need to pin the gem.

Change-Id: I614ce29e83265ee48bb5f35fdd4a956346b0c69d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/08/359408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # puppetlabs_spec_helper 1.2.0 pulled in a gem with ruby >= 2.2 requirements # but CI has ruby 2.0.0. gem 'puppetlabs_spec_helper', '1.1.1', :require => 'false'

subject: Update api-ref for v1.22
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 21:39:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/d8859546d957eb6b269386820a97f09144b2b0c0', 'message': 'Update api-ref for v1.22

This commit does several things, which were just easier to do together.

- Introduces a new script, api-ref/regenerate-samples.sh, which can be
  used with Ironic to automate the generation of most of the sample files
  used in the api-ref documententation.
- Corrects several errors in sample files, particularly the
  POST/PUT/PATCH examples that were non-functional.
- Updates many of the sample files to include current (v1.22) output.
- Adds descriptions of the node.resource_class and
  node.network_interface fields that were introduced into the API but
  not into the documentation.
- Adds a new "misc" page describing the /v1/lookup and /v1/heartbeat
  resources.

Change-Id: I764cbb43be15f05ba681de6ce1be1ae7c022173d

This commit does several things, which were just easier to do together.

- Adds a new "misc" page describing the /v1/lookup and /v1/heartbeat
  resources.
- Adds descriptions of the node.resource_class and
  node.network_interface fields that were introduced into the API but

commit_message:
Update api-ref for v1.22

This commit does several things, which were just easier to do together.

- Adds a new "misc" page describing the /v1/lookup and /v1/heartbeat
  resources.
- Adds descriptions of the node.resource_class and
  node.network_interface fields that were introduced into the API but
  not into the documentation.
- Introduces a new script, api-ref/regenerate-samples.sh, which can be
  used with Ironic to automate the generation of most of the sample files
  used in the api-ref documententation.
- Corrects several errors in the sample JSON files that rendered errors
  when using them with curl for POST, PUT, or PATCH.
- Uses the aforementioned regenerate-samples.sh script to regenerate
  most of the JSON result samples, ensuring that they are all up to date
  with the v1.22 API microversion.
- Removes a few old/incorrect "Error Code" listings.
- Updates the index page to remove extraneous wording.

Change-Id: I764cbb43be15f05ba681de6ce1be1ae7c022173d

an admin(user with admin role in admin_project)
would not need that.

We still support use of global_tenant flag for listing
stacks and software configs. However, by default
an admin(user with admin role in admin_project)
would not need that.

Change-Id: I12303dbf30fb80290f95baba0c67cdf684f5f409
'}]
commit_message:
Remove tenant_safe flag from rpc and db api

We can use admin_context to have access to stacks
and software configs across projects. This removes
the tenant_safe flag from rpc and db api. This is
backward compatible with older rpc clients.

We still support use of global_tenant flag for listing
stacks and software configs. However, by default
an admin(user with admin role in admin_project)
would not need that.

Change-Id: I12303dbf30fb80290f95baba0c67cdf684f5f409

commit_message:
Enable ra on gateway when add gateway to HA router

Now the 'accept_ra' will only be configured when HA router change
state to 'master'. If the router gateway is added after router state
change, the gateway port in 'master' HA router will not be configured.

This patch will configure 'accept_ra' for the 'master' HA router.

Change-Id: Ice1f3e6e48597ea8c366e243c2ca1771ea9b7770
Closes-bug: #1585246
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/23/320823/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if state == 'master' and ex_gw_port_id: interface_name = ri.get_external_device_name(ex_gw_port_id) if ri.router.get('distributed', False): namespace = ri.ha_namespace else: namespace = ri.ns_name ri._enable_ra_on_gw(ri.ex_gw_port, namespace, interface_name)
deleted_lines: if state == 'master' and ex_gw_port_id and ri.use_ipv6: gateway_ips = ri._get_external_gw_ips(ri.ex_gw_port) if not ri.is_v6_gateway_set(gateway_ips): interface_name = ri.get_external_device_name(ex_gw_port_id) if ri.router.get('distributed', False): namespace = ri.ha_namespace else: namespace = ri.ns_name ri.driver.configure_ipv6_ra(namespace, interface_name)

commit_message:
tempest/test_flavors: vcpus is in db

When Tempest list Trove flavors, the returned flavor contains name, ram
and vcpus.

An example of test run without this patch:

testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: {u'name': u'm1.nano', u'ram':
128, u'id': 42, u'links': [{u'href':
u'https://[::1]:8779/v1.0/04f8954d605644088e9f87cc3383dfef/flavors/42',
u'rel': u'self'}, {u'href': u'https://[::1]:8779/flavors/42', u'rel':
u'bookmark'}], u'str_id': u'42', u'vcpus': 1} matches Contains('vcpus')

We can see 'vcpus' is part of the flavor properties and need to be
checked in the validation.

Change-Id: I9bb18dc539e98bfe1e0d0b4dd1fe6263f95b6499
Closes-Bug: #1612398
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/87/356587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._check_values(['name', 'ram', 'vcpus'], db_flavor, os_flavor) self._check_values(['disk', 'swap'], db_flavor, os_flavor,
deleted_lines: self._check_values(['name', 'ram'], db_flavor, os_flavor) self._check_values(['disk', 'vcpus', 'swap'], db_flavor, os_flavor,

added_lines: # TODO(Graham Hayes): Remove the following block of code when os-api-ref is # using openstackdocstheme (in the 0.5.x release series) CUT_OVER_MINOR = 9 CUT_OVER_MAJOR = 0 import os_api_ref from oslo_utils import versionutils major, minor, _ = versionutils.convert_version_to_tuple(os_api_ref.__version__) if major > CUT_OVER_MAJOR or minor > CUT_OVER_MINOR: # We are on the new version with openstackdocstheme support extensions = [ 'os_api_ref', ] import openstackdocstheme # noqa html_theme = 'openstackdocs' html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()] html_theme_options = { "sidebar_mode": "toc", } else: # We are on the old version without openstackdocstheme support extensions = [ 'os_api_ref', 'oslosphinx', ] # End temporary block

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs_spec_helper to 1.1.1

With the release of puppetlabs_spec_helper 1.2.0, it started pulling in
a gem that requires ruby >= 2.2.0. Since CI currently runs on ruby 2.1,
we need to pin to an older release of puppetlabs_spec_helper.

Depends-On: Iec7ce821de1f03dc8730ebc689b441f6e053f143
Change-Id: Ib86204b91f62e96c4bf21cd668324f847718fe2a
Closes-Bug: #1616190
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/86/359386/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gem 'puppetlabs_spec_helper', '1.1.1', :require => 'false'

commit_message:
Improve code readability

Fox example: assertTrue(a in resp.headers and
                        b in resp.headers and
                        c not in resp.headers) is equal to:
             assertIn(a, resp.headers)
             assertIn(b, resp.headers)
             assertNotIn(c, resp.headers)

Change-Id: I8044d4a5c30fd9198b04466eb4c280e56995b28b

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: I92565bb4c17ca4b10886c78d35274c8b49d86bd6
Closes-Bug: #1614361

commit_message:
Jugde container-name length

Judge the length of container name at the beginning of a function,
that can reduce loads from wrong requests.

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs_spec_helper to 1.1.1

With the release of puppetlabs_spec_helper 1.2.0, it started pulling in
a gem that requires ruby >= 2.2.0. Since CI currently runs on ruby 2.1,
we need to pin to an older release of puppetlabs_spec_helper.

Depends-On: Iec7ce821de1f03dc8730ebc689b441f6e053f143
Change-Id: Ib86204b91f62e96c4bf21cd668324f847718fe2a
Closes-Bug: #1616190
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/88/359388/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gem 'puppetlabs_spec_helper', '1.1.1', :require => 'false'

commit_message:
Support purge of soft-deleted resources from DB tables

This commit adds support to purge soft-deleted resources and their
corresponding event entries from DB tables via tacker-db-manage

Implements: blueprint: audit-support

Co-Authored-By: Kanagaraj Manickam <mkr1481@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: gong yong sheng <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Vishwanath Jayaraman <vishwanathj@hotmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice3cca08c00941fa069e66de5d09fede2ab67322
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/52/329652/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def purge_deleted(age, granularity='days'): try: age = int(age) except ValueError: raise exception.Error(_("age should be an integer")) if age < 0: raise exception.Error(_("age should be a positive integer")) if granularity not in ('days', 'hours', 'minutes', 'seconds'): raise exception.Error( _("granularity should be days, hours, minutes, or seconds")) if granularity == 'days': age = age * 86400 elif granularity == 'hours': age = age * 3600 elif granularity == 'minutes': age = age * 60 time_line = timeutils.utcnow() - datetime.timedelta(seconds=age) engine = get_engine() meta = sqlalchemy.MetaData() meta.bind = engine vnf = sqlalchemy.Table('devices', meta, autoload=True) vnfd = sqlalchemy.Table('devicetemplates', meta, autoload=True) vim = sqlalchemy.Table('vims', meta, autoload=True) event = sqlalchemy.Table('events', meta, autoload=True) # find the soft-deleted resources that are past their expiry # TODO(vishwanathj) as part of device deletion, delete deviceattributes vnf_del = vnf.delete().where(vnf.c.deleted_at < time_line) engine.execute(vnf_del) vnfd_del = vnfd.delete().where(vnfd.c.deleted_at < time_line) engine.execute(vnfd_del) vim_del = vim.delete().where(vim.c.deleted_at < time_line) engine.execute(vim_del) # TODO(vishwanathj) provide option to not delete events table entries event_del_query = sqlalchemy.select([event.c.resource_id]).where( and_(event.c.resource_state == 'DELETED', event.c.timestamp < time_line)) event_data_del = event.delete().where( event.c.resource_id.in_(event_del_query)) engine.execute(event_data_del)

subject: VMware: enable a resize of instance with no root disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 09:45:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/676732b4ba67c79ddc49a3a8a1c7ecb8f9b43782', 'message': 'VMware: enable a resize of instance with no root disk

This addresses the issue when the user wishes to update the CPU
or memory of the instance.

No changes to disks will be done if there is no root disk.

Examples of when there is no root disk:
1. When an instance is booted from a cinder volume.
2. When booting from an ISO and the root disk size is zero

In these cases there will not be a disk created on the vmware
shared datastore.

Change-Id: I848fd3e57ec2f9cbc4fc31fd9ec3fe515fee4f32
Closes-bug: #1444446
(cherry picked from commit 54afe44c7b68902556850baf4eba0846b000aa35)
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: enable a resize of instance with no root disk

This addresses the issue when the user wishes to update the CPU
or memory of the instance.

No changes to disks will be done if there is no root disk.

Examples of when there is no root disk:
1. When an instance is booted from a cinder volume.
2. When booting from an ISO and the root disk size is zero

In these cases there will not be a disk created on the vmware
shared datastore.

Change-Id: I848fd3e57ec2f9cbc4fc31fd9ec3fe515fee4f32
Closes-bug: #1444446
(cherry picked from commit 54afe44c7b68902556850baf4eba0846b000aa35)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/347726/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(vmops.VMwareVMOps, '_create_swap') @mock.patch.object(vmops.VMwareVMOps, '_create_ephemeral') @mock.patch.object(ds_obj, 'get_datastore_by_ref', return_value='fake-ds-ref') @mock.patch.object(vm_util, 'get_vmdk_info') def _test_resize_create_ephemerals(self, vmdk, datastore, mock_get_vmdk_info, mock_get_datastore_by_ref, mock_create_ephemeral, mock_create_swap): mock_get_vmdk_info.return_value = vmdk dc_info = ds_util.DcInfo(ref='fake_ref', name='fake', vmFolder='fake_folder') with mock.patch.object(self._vmops, 'get_datacenter_ref_and_name', return_value=dc_info) as mock_get_dc_ref_and_name: self._vmops._resize_create_ephemerals_and_swap( 'vm-ref', self._instance, 'block-devices') mock_get_vmdk_info.assert_called_once_with( self._session, 'vm-ref', uuid=self._instance.uuid) if vmdk.device: mock_get_datastore_by_ref.assert_called_once_with( self._session, datastore.ref) mock_get_dc_ref_and_name.assert_called_once_with(datastore.ref) mock_create_ephemeral.assert_called_once_with( 'block-devices', self._instance, 'vm-ref', dc_info, 'fake-ds-ref', 'uuid', 'fake-adapter') mock_create_swap.assert_called_once_with( 'block-devices', self._instance, 'vm-ref', dc_info, 'fake-ds-ref', 'uuid', 'fake-adapter') else: self.assertFalse(mock_create_ephemeral.called) self.assertFalse(mock_get_dc_ref_and_name.called) self.assertFalse(mock_get_datastore_by_ref.called) def test_resize_create_ephemerals(self): datastore = ds_obj.Datastore(ref='fake-ref', name='fake') device = vmwareapi_fake.DataObject() backing = vmwareapi_fake.DataObject() backing.datastore = datastore.ref device.backing = backing vmdk = vm_util.VmdkInfo('[fake] uuid/root.vmdk', 'fake-adapter', 'fake-disk', 'fake-capacity', device) self._test_resize_create_ephemerals(vmdk, datastore) def test_resize_create_ephemerals_no_root(self): vmdk = vm_util.VmdkInfo(None, None, None, 0, None) self._test_resize_create_ephemerals(vmdk, None)

commit_message:
Updated from openstack-manuals

Change-Id: Id012ae923849e66623d72ff32c4e7cd17df56714
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/04/359504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: access control list (ACL) AWS CloudFormation allows Amazon Web Services (AWS) users to create and manage a certificate authority (CA) In cryptography, an entity that issues digital certificates. The digital certificate certifies the ownership of a public key by the named subject of the certificate. This enables others (relying parties) to rely upon signatures or assertions made by the private key that corresponds to the certified public key. In this model of trust relationships, a CA is a trusted third party for both the subject (owner) of the certificate and the party relying upon the certificate. CAs are characteristic of many public key infrastructure (PKI) schemes. In OpenStack, a simple certificate authority is provided by Compute for cloudpipe VPNs and VM image decryption. Cloud Auditing Data Federation (CADF) Cloud Auditing Data Federation (CADF) is a specification for audit event data. CADF is supported by OpenStack Identity.
deleted_lines: access control list ACL See access control list. AWS Amazon Web Services. AWS CloudFormation allows AWS users to create and manage a CA Certificate Authority or Certification Authority. In cryptography, an entity that issues digital certificates. The digital certificate certifies the ownership of a public key by the named subject of the certificate. This enables others (relying parties) to rely upon signatures or assertions made by the private key that corresponds to the certified public key. In this model of trust relationships, a CA is a trusted third party for both the subject (owner) of the certificate and the party relying upon the certificate. CAs are characteristic of many public key infrastructure (PKI) schemes. CADF Cloud Auditing Data Federation (CADF) is a specification for audit event data. CADF is supported by OpenStack Identity. certificate authority A simple certificate authority provided by Compute for cloudpipe VPNs and VM image decryption. CMDB Configuration Management Database.

commit_message:
Update instance host in post live migration even when exception occurs

Currently when, e.g., port binding fails on destination host nova
loses track of running VM. Operator needs to change record in DB
manually in order to recover VM in nova and then perform operations
on destination host to repair such VM. Because VM is on destination
host already it should be updated regardless of post live migration
at destination result.


(cherry picked from commit 89b1fecce116bc44f558e76cbb5dc43497ea67cc)

Change-Id: Ibb5158f453abd9717e6d2ab501295351ca9d0dcf
Closes-Bug: #1379581
Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

commit_message:
Add mariadb client binaries to kolla-toolbox

The kolla-toolbox container contains ansible which has the mysql_db
module which helps on various mysql tasks such as db creation. The
mysql_db module requires certain mysql binaries in order to accomplish
tasks such as restoring a database from a dump.

This change adds those client libraries which weren't previously
included in the container.

Change-Id: I6516838381bf9327c8901fc4c32ebd5151fb053f
Signed-off-by: Stephan Michaud <michauds90@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1616155

commit_message:
Revert "FWaaS v2 Database"

This reverts commit 39e4dd9a1539a2387beb0e1e8940a4e515608dc9.

As the commit had multiple db migration problems,
it's better to revert it for now and try again after
enabling tests. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/357028/

Change-Id: I69533e568bfd9ceed0715d400b8ca3f87553758b
Closes-Bug: #1615572
Closes-Bug: #1615577
Closes-Bug: #1615578

Add the guideline for other top level resources

Update the devref to guide other top level resources
using OSC plugin.

closes-Bug: #1591046

commit_message:
Remve old cache files on the mirror server

Change-Id: I5a0dee59a2db5e1584c334fc982524d1130b5448
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/06/348806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Remove any files older then 3 days that arn't the current-tripleo pin find */*/* -type f -name metadata.txt -mtime +3 -not -samefile current-tripleo/metadata.txt | \ xargs --no-run-if-empty dirname | \ xargs --no-run-if-empty -t rm -rf

commit_message:
Make Name parameter positional argument in DOCs and devstack lib

Name is made as mandatory and positional argument in getting started &
manual installation docs.

Also updated the devstack lib.

Change-Id: I5bd87925fc7ee89fdd44f873818d55fdd81611ac
Partial-Bug: #1474966

commit_message:
Update the 'list' method of volumeprovider about Cinder

'fuxi' in search_opts should be extracted from CONF:
Otherwise, CONF.volume_from changed, cmd docker volume ls could not obtain the
expected result

Change-Id: I2d021d26a5c73f4d231ddc638dc204041ddce29b
Closes-Bug: #1609763
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuxi refs/changes/01/351501/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: search_opts = {'metadata': {consts.VOLUME_FROM: CONF.volume_from}}

commit_message:
run_tests: disable TestEncryptedCinderVolumes tests

Something broke in Cinder and we'll need those 2 patches to run
TestEncryptedCinderVolumes again:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358670/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/359391/

Until they are merged, let's ignore the tests.

Change-Id: Ibbe9544cb2991d16499993975694ec4fe6859f0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/26/359426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove admin-state-down from lbaas-member-update

lbaas-member-update used --admin-state-down, which was deprecated
in Mitaka. It has been removed in this version using this patch.

Change-Id: I5c4492e6d121b0ae73e21aa3ba0594446fa46d3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/06/306906/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import argparse ['weight', 'name']) '--admin-state-down', dest='admin_state', action='store_false', default=argparse.SUPPRESS, help=_('[DEPRECATED in Mitaka] Set admin state up to false.')) parser.add_argument( dest='admin_state', # ToDo(reedip): After Mitaka, remove admin-state-down if hasattr(parsed_args, 'admin_state'): body['admin_state_up'] = parsed_args.admin_state

commit_message:
Add comment about how status field changed

There are some review comments on the status , vm_state
changes confusion in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258472
for this bug, so this patch added some comments to make
reviewer easier to read the code logic.

Change-Id: I65e77feeddcf477bd5550baaa440b4a1a325bb91
Related-Bug: 1526715

commit_message:
Update oslo.context requirement to 2.9.0

In the 2.9.0 release of oslo.context there are changes to the base
from_dict method that will help to cleanup the from_dict in all the
service's from_dict overrides and help with policy.

Change-Id: I00d0db3738b0099fabe263b3765533d9655385f9

commit_message:
Cloud admin script auto-config hostconfig defaults

- Support for auto-generation of hostconfig JSON for use with
  pseudo port binding controller for networking-odl
- Command line options added for customization of hostconfigs
- Auto dectect OVS data path type for appropriate hostconfig JSON generation

Change-Id: Ie0173abe461b5c4a0de3524c98dfa83b405eb829

Cloud admin script, OVS default config support

Add support for default configuration of cloud admin scripts

Change-Id: I589ba1b9c7424aeed78e9b11577fe9d8613a5107

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ie83d8c3b62a6140ca71bb5889cffd3eb138c8658

commit_message:
Remove obsolete doc-test.conf

With openstack-doc-tools 1.0.0, this file is not used anymore, remove
it.

Also, remove all mention of openstack-doc-test, this tool is not anymore
part of openstack-doc-tools.

Change-Id: I3bebcb269f1ff067e2ba591dd9e3d8f47d31d306

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 23:34:26.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/d9d3964e2fd07906d07bfa06f4564995bd8bf0c7', 'message': "Install python-openstackclient before plugins

Everything except for OSC installs before plugins, then plugins run.
That's great, because if a devstack plugin needs to do something
explicit with the software installed, it can. But then OSC gets
installed and can step on the install that was done by the plugin.

Just move it to before the plugin, so that plugins can have the final
say on versions of things installed.

Change-Id: I2c5658945fda5a66aa26fc4ac111f109ba79c5a6
"}]
commit_message:
Install python-openstackclient before plugins

Everything except for OSC installs before plugins, then plugins run.
That's great, because if a devstack plugin needs to do something
explicit with the software installed, it can. But then OSC gets
installed and can step on the install that was done by the plugin.

Just move it to before the plugin, so that plugins can have the final
say on versions of things installed.

Change-Id: I2c5658945fda5a66aa26fc4ac111f109ba79c5a6

commit_message:
Set cinder::api::bind_host within service template

The map_replace at [1] will replace the network name
with the local node IP address on the given network.

1. I7850d4dc8bf4db5f7ac6a6b53c1d900b561b4580

commit_message:
Correct link to image properties

Correct link to image properties as listed in the CLI reference guide.
Existing link used a no longer existing anchor and just took the user
to the root of the glance chapter of the guide.

Closes-Bug: 1606608
Change-Id: I6421f0373c7d24afe0f5e73f936ecdedca15f89f

commit_message:
Add Plan Deletion

This patch adds a mistral action that deletes a plan by deleting
the swift container and mistral environment matching a given container
name. It will not delete the plan if a stack exists with the same name.

Change-Id: I601aa2072271e072201be0c7d7237e0108494fb5
Partial-Bug: 1613196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/37/299937/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heatclient import exc as heatexceptions import six from swiftclient import exceptions as swiftexceptions class DeletePlanAction(base.TripleOAction): """Deletes a plan and associated files Deletes a plan by deleting the container matching plan_name. It will not delete the plan if a stack exists with the same name. Raises StackInUseError if a stack with the same name as plan_name exists. """ def __init__(self, auth_token, auth_uri, tenant_id, username, container): super(DeletePlanAction, self).__init__(auth_token, auth_uri, tenant_id, username) self.container = container def run(self): # heat throws HTTPNotFound if the stack is not found try: stack = self._get_orchestration_client().stacks.get(self.container) if stack is not None: raise exception.StackInUseError(name=self.container) except heatexceptions.HTTPNotFound: try: oc = self._get_object_client() # delete files from plan for data in oc.get_container(self.container)[1]: oc.delete_object(self.container, data['name']) # delete plan container oc.delete_container(self.container) # deletes environment self._get_workflow_client().environments.delete(self.container) except swiftexceptions.ClientException as ce: LOG.exception("Swift error deleting plan.") if ce.http_status == 404: six.raise_from(exception.PlanDoesNotExistError( name=self.container), ce) except Exception: LOG.exception("Error deleting plan.") raise

commit_message:
Fix unbracket_ipv6()

Due to a bug, the logical condition as previously written only took
into account the second part. This patch amends the condition so that
both parts of the condition are properly evaluated.

Change-Id: I3c72787c912e1b37dab24f26666cc4f12ef53317
(cherry picked from commit 2a9a168a4e58a208817aaf2b9be3a2ca5b3d00d5)

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: I841a6ab55ee01677dc5279d96416923303be339b
Closes-Bug: #1614361

commit_message:
[sshutils] Catch socket.error in put_file

`_put_file_sftp` can raise different types of errors. paramiko.SSHException,
socket.error are most frequent. Let's catch socket.error too

Change-Id: I435cd0c9e140745ec24e4d4f51d7bd4a7740d7f9

commit_message:
Moving of HttpRequests scenarios into separate classes

This patch moving methods from one HttpRequest class into
several independed classes (by one on each method) with keeping
of original names of scenarios. Also this patch contains updated
unit tests for HttpRequests scenarios

Change-Id: Ia252ecc4b49ebc3d1a8eba2307e259c907e4ec9c

commit_message:
Add 'More Actions' constant text

We're adding 'More Actions' as a constant for two reasons: a) because
it will be reused among many registrations and should be configurable,
and b) because we want to ensure it gets translated before the end of the
release.

Change-Id: I709e99e0c5b855718ef94e173fddc4b48e67f904

subject: Add DB retry logic in ML2 delete_port()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 11:11:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5f28ace457f3a00cc759ce826ea8aadb60738f37', 'message': 'Add DB retry logic in ML2 delete_port()

I9aa792dc5711724ec40d7142570562a816112712 applied the db retry logic
to update_port_status(), but seems like in some cases, it is also
needed on delete_port()

Bug 1613251 describes an issue where the deletion if a loadbalancer
vip_port fail with StaleDataError.
This happens when the you delete a loadbalancer and then try
to delete its vip port, which in the mean time gets updated as well,
thus, raise the StaleDataError.

Change-Id: Icbe040c4bc813f32419c8359d3bec9945b09269a
Closes-Bug: #1613251
'}]
commit_message:
Add DB retry logic in ML2 delete_port()

I9aa792dc5711724ec40d7142570562a816112712 applied the db retry logic
to update_port_status(), but seems like in some cases, it is also
needed on delete_port()

Bug 1613251 describes an issue where the deletion if a loadbalancer
vip_port fail with StaleDataError.
This happens when the you delete a loadbalancer and then try
to delete its vip port, which in the mean time gets updated as well,
thus, raise the StaleDataError.

Change-Id: Icbe040c4bc813f32419c8359d3bec9945b09269a
Closes-Bug: #1613251

commit_message:
Remove q-lbaas from the nodepool pre-configured list

The in-tree devstack support is going away, so this is all plugin. Will this
require tweaking on any existing jobs? They should all be using the plugin
at this point.

Change-Id: I80ba46d241e121f7a31e00c6090185b79ed9847c

added_lines: * Install Firefox browser <= ver. 46.0. It is the stable browser version to work with selenium. To downgrade the Firefox browser neet to do the following commands:* * remove firefox * wget https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/46.0/linux-x86_64/en-US/firefox-46.0.tar.bz2 * tar -xjf firefox-46.0.tar.bz2 * rm -rf /opt/firefox * mv firefox /opt/firefox46 * ln -s /opt/firefox46/firefox /usr/bin/firefox * Also tests can be run in Google Chrome browser * Selenium version to successfully work with test 2.53.6 * If needed to run the test on remote server the X server need to be configured on remote. Also proposed to use the VNC to see the test in real-time in browser. To config these prerequisites need to do the following commands: * install python-pip xvfb xfonts-100dpi xfonts-75dpi xfonts-cyrillic xorg dbus-x11 xvfb * install xvfb xfonts-100dpi xfonts-75dpi xfonts-cyrillic xorg dbus-x11 * "Xvfb -fp "/usr/share/fonts/X11/misc/" :$DISPLAY -screen 0 "1280x1024x16" &" where $DISPLAY - is display parameter * install --yes x11vnc * x11vnc -bg -forever -nopw -display :$DISPLAY -ncache 10 * sudo iptables -I INPUT 1 -p tcp --dport 5900 -j ACCEPT * Export $DISPLAY variable the same as Xvfb server used horizon_url = http://localhost/dashboard keystone_url = http://localhost:5000/v3

commit_message:
Correct the wrong ":guilabel:" markup value

There should be "Edit Image" dialog box and should be "Edit Image" button,
not "Update Image". This patch fix them.

Change-Id: Ibc0a3f5610a3f7765296b1b71ec44936fcb3834b
Closes-Bug: #1615660

commit_message:
Block pecan 1.0.2/1.0.3/1.0.4

ironic-api doesn't work with specified pecan versions.
Distros rely on values from global-requirements when setting
dependency caps for packages. We need to block non-working versions
to keep openstack packages dependencies in sync.

Change-Id: I7f34d6bc2f098086c086c3ea0410672d6139d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1615645

commit_message:
Modifying Keystone bootstrap to use secrets

This PS modified Keystone bootstrap to use secrets and adding
variables to kolla-kubernetes.yaml to make Keystone deployment
wihtout manual editing of the service configuration files.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I933e8d764a3b19651d25837f095287b29a4d0b09

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tox environments

Infra setup has been changed, remove now obsolote environments.

Also remove unused doc-tests.conf file, with current openstack-doc-tests

commit_message:
Fix db vs migration mismatches

Fix the following mismatch found by test_migrations test.

    AssertionError: Models and migration scripts aren't in sync:
    [ ( 'remove_constraint',        UniqueConstraint(Column('firewall_policy_id', VARCHAR(length=36), Foreig
nKey(u'firewall_policies_v2.id'), ForeignKey(u'firewall_policies_v2.id'), table=
<firewall_policy_rule_associations_v2>, primary_key=True, nullable=False))),
      ( 'remove_constraint',
        UniqueConstraint(Column('firewall_rule_id', VARCHAR(length=36), ForeignK
ey(u'firewall_rules_v2.id'), ForeignKey(u'firewall_rules_v2.id'), table=<firewal
l_policy_rule_associations_v2>, primary_key=True, nullable=False)))]

Closes-Bug: #1615572
Change-Id: I3d53e715c73739dbb1cb351d92c417e540492a65

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is now ready to use constraints everywhere [1], so adapt
releasenotes, coverage, and venv to use the default install command
instead of a specific non-constrained install command.

With this change, all tox environments now use constraints.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

Change-Id: I879f34129c0d958be0a73bfdc7f641e178d4efe9

As well as this announcement:

Change-Id: Ie1e1afa1db2690c7960697dfbd8acaeab5d6c79e
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Ie1e1afa1db2690c7960697dfbd8acaeab5d6c79e

commit_message:
storage: make sure the deletion tests are synchronous

Otherwise there's a little chance it fails on storage backends that
share their test run.

Change-Id: Idbd9db3cbd55fa50e782e13d85602fdd3a949f9c

commit_message:
storage: do not list metrics on each measure processing

This should simplify and speed-up test run. Also add a specific test to
check list_metric_with_measures_to_process().

Change-Id: I981f19ec658a4d9928b9170876b3f5782041806b

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for upper constraints

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: I545f5fae81deadd4166f5d815b798416d4cb9b80
Closes-Bug: #1614361

commit_message:
Add group types and group specs

This patch adds support for group types and group specs
in the client.

Server patch is merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320165/

Current microversion is 3.11. The following CLI's are supported.
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-create my_test_group
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-show my_test_group
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-key my_test_group
    set test_key=test_val
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-specs-list
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-key my_test_group
    unset test_key
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-update <group type uuid>
    --name "new_group" --description "my group type"
cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.11 group-type-delete new_group

Change-Id: I161a96aa53208e78146cb115d500fd6b2c42d046
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group
